result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Allen Howen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the close of business tomorrow.  
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes: Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment.

Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow all recommendations. 
Def is to complete individual counseling or group counseling that addresses issues surrounding domestic violence and prevention as directed by the DOC. 
The Def is to obtain assessments and counseling/programming as directed by DOC to include MRT if appropriate.
The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed! 
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
The defendant is ordered to random testing.
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.

timeConds.notes:
Contact ACJ with in 10 days to make arrangements to serve jail, not to commence any later than 9 a.m. on 10/30/22.  
Granted Huber under the terms set by Sheriff.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Allen Howen

records.addlTxt: 1:15 PM Defendant Joseph Allen Howen in court.  Attorney Rachel E. Pisors appeared by video for Joseph Allen Howen.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CM166, 21CM175, and 22CM7.  State has complied with victim rights.  Letter in file 22CM7 from victim has been reviewed by court.  Victim is present in court, makes a statement.  State comments on sentencing.  Attorney comments on sentencing.  Def makes a statement.  See attached for sentencing.
Sentencing hearing on September 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

10:15 AM Defendant Joseph Allen Howen in court.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rachel E. Pisors appeared by video for Joseph Allen Howen.  Cases 21CM166, 21CM175, and 22CM7.  Parties have agreement.  State has complied with victim rights.  Atty and def admit that he is a repeater and admits that they are acts of domestic abuse.  Atty def PLEADS NO CONTEST.  Files contain PLQ, understands info, rights giving up, and elements. Back on the record at 10:31.  Atty and def ready to go forward.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied that def is knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently pleading NO CONTEST and accepts.  As a factual basis can court rely on the compliant in the cases, parties agree, court finds a factual basis exists, finds GUILTY and direct judgment to enter.  Jury trial dates are off the calendar.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plea hearing on August 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on September 13, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 10, 2022 at 08:00 am.

02:05 PM Defendant Joseph Allen Howen in court with attorney Rachel E. Pisors.  David V. Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 21CM166,21CM175,22CM7--   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. Cases are here for a STC. Atty comments- no agreement in the cases. Atty asking for a 22CM7 be tried first. State is asking for 21CM166 be heard first, 21CM175 second and 22CM7 be heard last. Parties agree all three are one day trials. 
21CM166--JT12- 9/13/22 #3
21CM175 JT12- 10/11/22 #3
22CM7-JT12-  11/10/22 #2
Ct will do schd order's in each case.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
to Judge McK fr Vic (re: def) - filed by DA's Office
ACJ Bond Payment receipt, Bail Bond Info Sheet from ACJ, Notice RE Posting Bond form and a copy of signed cash bond
